bugs.title: CVE-2019-12111 miniupnpd: null pointer dereference in copyIPv6IfDifferent in pcpserver.c causing denial of service

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12111 miniupnpd: null pointer dereference in copyIPv6IfDifferent in pcpserver.c causing denial of service

long_desc.thetext:
A Denial Of Service vulnerability in MiniUPnP MiniUPnPd through 2.1 exists due to a NULL pointer dereference in copyIPv6IfDifferent in pcpserver.c.

Reference:
https://www.vdoo.com/blog/security-issues-discovered-in-miniupnp

Upstream commit:
https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/commit/cb8a02af7a5677cf608e86d57ab04241cf34e24f

Created miniupnpd tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1711246]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only

you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12110 miniupnp: null-pointer dereference in upnpredirect.c causing denial of service

bugs.title: CVE-2019-12107 miniupnpd: miniupnp: information disclosure in function upnp_event_prepare in upnpevents.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12107 miniupnpd: miniupnp: information disclosure in function upnp_event_prepare in upnpevents.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12107 miniupnp: information disclosure in function upnp_event_prepare in upnpevents.c

long_desc.thetext:
The upnp_event_prepare function in upnpevents.c in MiniUPnP MiniUPnPd through 2.1 allows a remote attacker to leak information from the heap due to improper validation of an snprintf return value.

Upstream commit:
https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/commit/bec6ccec63cadc95655721bc0e1dd49dac759d94

Reference:
https://www.vdoo.com/blog/security-issues-discovered-in-miniupnp
